prompt: <description>**Construct the base part** **Part 1: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side (base part)** The base part of the final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered in the image. Before starting to create the part, ensure that a new coordinate system is created with the euler angles set to (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector set to (0, 0, 0). **Step 1: Create a 2D sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **Step 2: Draw the curves** Draw four lines as follows: - Line 1: From point (0, 0) to point (0.75, 0) - Line 2: From point (0.75, 0) to point (0.75, 0.2753) - Line 3: From point (0.75, 0.2753) to point (0, 0.2753) - Line 4: From point (0, 0.2753) to point (0, 0) **Step 3: Create loops** Create a loop with all the four lines. **Step 4: Create faces** Create a face from the loop. **Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0816 units along the normal direction of the sketch. The operation is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation" as it creates a new solid body. **Step 7: Save the part** Save the part as part 1. **Construct the subsequent parts** The subsequent parts build upon the previously constructed parts using the operation defined for that part. **Part 2: Add a floor to the prism** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle covering the entire bottom surface of the prism. Extrude the rectangle by 0.2 units along the negative Z direction. The operation is a "JoinFeatureOperation" as it adds material to the base part. **Part 3: Add a curved side to the prism** Create a new sketch on the face of part 1 corresponding to the top surface. Draw a circle with its center at the center of the top surface and a radius of 0.25 units. Extrude the circle by 0.4 units along the normal direction of the sketch. The operation is a "JoinFeatureOperation" as it adds material to the base part. **Part 4: Add a lid to the prism** Create a new sketch on the face of part 3 corresponding to the curved side. Draw a circle with its center at the center of the curve and a radius of 0.2 units. Extrude the circle by 0.1 units along the normal direction of the sketch. The operation is a "JoinFeatureOperation" as it adds material to the base part. **Part 5: Add a hole to the prism** Create a new sketch on the face of part 4 corresponding to the lid. Draw a circle with its center at the center of the lid and a radius of 0.1 units. Extrude the circle by 0.05 units along the negative Z direction. The operation is a "CutFeatureOperation" as it removes material from the base part. **Part 6: Add a mounting feature to the prism** Create a new sketch on the face of part 5 corresponding to the bottom surface. Draw a rectangle with its vertical sides aligned with the X and Y axes and its horizontal sides covering a quarter of the width and length respectively. Extrude the rectangle by 0.1 units along the positive Z direction. The operation is a "JoinFeatureOperation" as it adds material to the base part. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side, with a floor, a curved side, a lid, a hole, and a mounting feature.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.2753]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.2753],"End Point":[0.0,0.2753]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2753],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0816,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.2379, 0.0 On the XY plane of this coordinate system, create a new sketch with the following components: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Circle 1 - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.375 Scale the sketch by 0.75. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1586 units. The resulting part should resemble a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. **Part 2: Three-Dimensional Pyramidal Object** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.1391, 0.0793, 0.4801 On the XY plane of this coordinate system, create a new sketch with the following components: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1 - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0445] - End Point: [0.0374, 0.0] - Line 2 - Start Point: [0.0374, 0.0] - End Point: [0.0955, 0.0015] - Line 3 - Start Point: [0.0955, 0.0015] - End Point: [0.1306, 0.0478] - Line 4 - Start Point: [0.1306, 0.0478] - End Point: [0.1162, 0.1042] - Line 5 - Start Point: [0.1162, 0.1042] - End Point: [0.0632, 0.128] - Line 6 - Start Point: [0.0632, 0.128] - End Point: [0.0115, 0.1015] - Line 7 - Start Point: [0.0115, 0.1015] - End Point: [0.0, 0.0445] Scale the sketch by 0.1306. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0793 units. The resulting part should resemble a three-dimensional pyramidal object with a flat base and a tapered top. **Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Middle Section** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.2246, 0.0793, 0.1264 On the XY plane of this coordinate system, create a new sketch with the following components: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Circle 1 - Center: [0.0711, 0.0711] - Radius: 0.0711 Scale the sketch by 0.1422. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0793 units. The resulting part should resemble a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The final assembly should consist of the three parts described above, interconnected in the specified order. The cylindrical base and top parts should join seamlessly with the pyramidal protrusions on either side. The resulting shape should be symmetrical with a smooth surface.</description>

Face 2: Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * Line 1: (0.0, 0.2461) to (0.2578, 0.2461) * Line 2: (0.2578, 0.2461) to (0.2578, 0.3633) * Line 3: (0.2578, 0.3633) to (0.0, 0.3633) * Line 4: (0.0, 0.3633) to (0.0, 0.2461) Switch to a 3D sketch by transforming the 2D sketch with the coordinate system properties. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D shape, with an extrusion depth of 0.0293 towards the normal. **Part 2: Adding smaller rectangles along the length of the prism** Create a new coordinate system, and follow the same pattern as Part 1 for the other two smaller rectangles to be aligned along the length of the prism. Follow the shapes and dimensions described in the JSON. Perform the necessary boolean operations (NewBodyFeatureOperation, JoinFeatureOperation, etc.) while creating each part to combine them as per the design. Lastly, provide the appropriate naming and description for each face, loop, curve, and part. This will make the CAD model easy to recognize and modify in the future. Be sure to include the shape, length, width, and height information provided in the JSON. After completing all parts, it should result in an accurate CAD model of a rectangular prism with smaller rectangles aligned along its length.</description>
